title: Prospiracy Theories
summary:
Key ideas:
- Conspiracy theories are more shareable on social media than debunkings or true beliefs.
- Conspiracy theories are specifically designed to exploit cognitive biases and social media pressures.
- Debunkings and true beliefs cannot replicate the efficiency of conspiracy theories in spreading on social media.

Key learnings:
- It is important to be aware of how cognitive biases and social media pressures can affect our perception of information.
- Debunkings and true beliefs need to find more effective ways to spread on social media to combat the spread of misinformation.

Key questions:
- How can debunkings and true beliefs be made more shareable on social media?
- What role do social media companies have in combating the spread of misinformation?
- How can individuals better recognize their own cognitive biases when engaging with information on social media?
